data.text: The Worst Medical Emergency while Bicycle Touring
What was the worst medical emergency you've had while touring, and how did you get care?
Brown Recluse Spiders bite. Free VA hospital care.
data.author: Gary Palmer

data.text: wow. When you got bit, what did you do? I assume the VA was the end point of care.
data.author: John Melton

data.text: at the beginning I thought it was a ant bite. It was tiny. Happened while camping sleeping on the ground, no tent. About 1 am I felt a pinch on my leg, looked at it and saw a tiny bite. Went back to sleep. In the morning it had become a dime sized 1/4 inch deep hole. I was near Tucson AZ. Went to the VA hospital and they bandaged me up and gave me antibiotics. Took 6 weeks to completely heal.
data.author: Gary Palmer

data.text: I do not take questions from a dog.
data.author: Jhony Tim

data.text: ???
data.author: David Niven

data.text: It was a joke, see profile picture.
data.author: Jhony Tim

data.text: phew. Thought you were still in a psychotic state. "I was testing the mushrooms..."
data.author: John Melton

data.text: Infected fire ant bite on toe, had to go to clinic and get antibiotics
data.author: Caitlin McCauley

data.text: I had an ear infection resulting in a perforated eardrum, but thanks to having filled out an E111 form before going to the continent the costs were all covered by EU reciprocal healthcare. ***K Brexit!
data.author: Steven Offord

data.text: I absolutely agree brexit has destroyed our freedom ...I did a 4 month bike ride spain and france now that's gone
data.author: Keith Ai

data.text: Yes, there's lots in the DIY camper van community that used to live on the continent full time. Their life choices are wrecked now.
data.author: Steven Offord

data.text: You can still use an E111 form in Europe
data.author: Peter Tomlin

data.text: Thanks. I actually thought that the E111 had been superseded by another form long before we left the EU, I'll certainly look into that before I travel. I've actually not even bothered to renew my passport at the moment.
data.author: Steven Offord

data.text: Never had any to deal with any of my own but I'm EMT certified and always carry a comprehensive kit with me because it's only a matter of time.
data.author: Jake Klamerus

data.text: that's cool. My last major crash, the first guy who stopped to help was a retired physician. He was good letting me clean my own wounds.
data.author: John Melton

data.text: Bee flew into my lip and stung me WHILE I WAS BREATHING WITH MY MOUTH OPEN. Stinger extraction required help from my cycle buddy, then I put antihistamine cream on it and took Benadryl. Always have Benadryl.
data.author: Carter AL

data.text: Not me, but I saw a woman miss a bridge on the Virginia Creeper Trail. Other bikers had medical training and had her ready for a stokes basket when the rescue team showed up. She went by 4x4 to a nearby meadow where Llife Guard helo picked her up. She had a head injury with fracture and broken arm and collar bone. Possibly other that wasn't apparent on site. Yes she was wearing a helmet but it apparently cracked with first impact and wasn't any help for subsequent impact on the way down.
data.author: Kathryn Fox

data.text: omg which bridge was it do you remember and how in the world do you miss it? they are so clearly marked. that is absolutely horrific
data.author: Elizabeth Wooten

data.text: it was one of the first few bridges. She looked behind her and veered to the right.
data.author: Kathryn Fox

data.text: im so sorry that is horrible and horrible for you to witness wow
data.author: Elizabeth Wooten

data.text: it was kind of a WTH moment. One second she was there and Blink she was gone.
data.author: Kathryn Fox

data.text: A good friend had a serious case of saddle sores... Best treatment was for him to receive massage of antiseptic cream to the affected area, followed by a therapeutic massage to stimulate blood circulation to the area..... Needless to say, he was allowed suffer without any of the above 'best treatment' but was asked by the group to do so silently!!! ðŸ˜‚
data.author: Anthony Coyne

data.text: Hit by a car, called an ambulance.
data.author: Bridget McGill

data.text: Bee in mouth...spit it out.
data.author: Larry Morgan

data.text: In Spain, my wife had a cactus spine in her finger. Thought nothing of it. Three weeks later an infection that could not be treated by oral antibiotics. I ended up injecting her twice a day with antibiotics. Two weeks later still a problem. Surgery. Four weeks of rehab. Six weeks in Rome altogether. Insurance covered it after some very heated discussions. Something so small...
data.author: Grant Griffin

data.text: Still recovering....3 weeks in I got mrsa in my butt. No open sore, It got bad quick. 3 days in hospital getting IV antibiotics. Flew home, surgery and then 4 more days in hospital getting IV antibiotics. Month later still have open wound.
data.author: Sandi Donnenwirth Remson

data.text: Cut my finger with Leatherman tool .
data.author: Shawn Goodrum

data.text: I cought my foot between the road and my pedal, it was horrible. Couldn't walk for couple days.. After resting I continue
data.author: William Sloth

data.text: What happens when reading a list like this is that you get all panicky and think 'Bike travel is dangerous!'. Because what's not documented here is the tens of thousands of bike trips where nothing at all happened.
data.author: Thomas Arson

data.text: accidents happen, probably to everyone. I dont agree that this scares people. Almost all of this is non- cycling specific (except hiit buy a car or to lesser extent, saddle sores). I was really curious to see how people got help, especially with isolated trips and being solo at times. I think people are smart enough to understand that accidents happen and can learn from other help options.
data.author: John Melton

data.text: Shattered my collar bone, I called an ambulance
data.author: Andy McMahon

data.text: A witch turned me into a frog in Bulgaria, but I got better, I'm never going back there.
data.author: Donald Canard

data.text: a frog that looks like a duck...
data.author: Thomas Arson

data.text: What can I say it was a bad time....
data.author: Donald Canard

data.text: Hit-n-run was taken to the ER
data.author: Jeff Flint

data.text: I have a diagnosed lung and eye condition. On my very first tour my vision in my left eye started to blur. Got constantly worse over the day and I felt pressure building up in the eye and around that area. Was able to ride extra 40km to a pharmacy after having consulted with my doctor through the phone. Got to the pharmacy and they were out of stock for that partigular drug. Then had no choice than to get the very next bus to a place where I could be picked up by a friend and he drove me then to the hospital. Turned out there was fluid buildup which was very thick and viscous both blockin my eyesight and creating pressure. Was very close to permanently losing my sight on the left eye. Got the right medication to stabilize the situation, got a stent put in place somewhere in the eye to help with draining excess fluid and had to keep exercise to a minimum for four weeks. By then vacation was over and back to work.
data.author: Andri Freyr SigurÃ°sson

data.text: Coughed so hard out of nowhere and I broke a rib. It hurt so much I had to cancel the trip.
data.author: Jeff Osborn

data.text: I farted so hard once and massively followed through. It was in the Atacama desert and these was very little water about. It was very stinky for a long time,but I'd rather not talk about it, thanks....
data.author: Donald Canard

data.text: An emergency crap ðŸ’© but donâ€™t know if that can be counted as a medical emergency ðŸš¨
data.author: Carl Seymour

data.text: I've had some G.I. issues compounded with high traffic location that would probably qualify as at least a "clean up on aisle 5".
data.author: John Melton

data.text: Food poisoning. A complete stranger let me sleep on her sofa for a day while my mom drove up to get me. Sometimes even when you are 35 years old, you need Mom to come fix things. She was so happy to be able to come help me out. Probably my best visit ever with her.
data.author: Lynn Haas

data.text: Solo biking in Slovenia; crashed when turning onto deep gravel road - was helped by good samaritans. They called a taxi to take me to a tiny emergency room because I had a pretty good concussion and was very confused. Rested, got back to it a couple days later!
data.author: Anne Stepan

data.text: C. Diff. I always over prepare and had vancomycin capsules for it. I also got hep a in India from a street vendor.
data.author: Evan Qualey
